comments.author: C(h)ristine
comments.content: I loooove Tartine.  I picked up their cookbook, and just flip through the pages tasting the pastries and using it mostly as a picture book.  I have yet to bake anything out of there (because I'm spoiled enough to live within driving distance of the bakery), but now I know that if I do, I'm in good hands!

comments.author: rich
comments.content:
The only downside to the book is that they didn't include the recipe for their bread.

For me the walnut bread is the best bread I've had in the Bay Area, but perhaps that's because I can pick it up at Tartine at 5pm just out of the oven.
